description: This is a JavaScript source file defining a Sidebar component for a web application. It handles rendering a navigational sidebar with expandable groups, route-aware active states, localization support, persistent state via localStorage, accessibility features, and interaction behaviors such as keyboard support and toggle actions.

methods.name: getExpandedMap()
methods.description: Reads the expanded/collapsed state map of sidebar groups from persistent storage.

methods.name: setExpandedMap(map)
methods.description: Persists the expanded/collapsed state map into storage.

methods.name: isPathActive(itemPath, routePath)
methods.description: Determines whether a given navigation item path matches the current route path, indicating an active state.

methods.name: buildGroup({ id, label, children }, expanded, routePath)
methods.description: Constructs the DOM structure for a collapsible group section with its child links.

methods.name: buildLink({ label, path }, routePath)
methods.description: Creates a DOM node for a single navigation link.

methods.name: renderSidebar(container, i18n, route)
methods.description: Renders the entire sidebar navigation structure into the container element, considering current route and localization.

methods.name: attachBehaviors(container, router)
methods.description: Sets up event handlers for interactions such as toggle expand/collapse, keyboard navigation, and route change updates.

methods.name: initSidebar(rootEl, router, i18n)
methods.description: Public API to initialize the sidebar component, set up reactive rendering based on route and language changes, and manage cleanup.

ctags.name: buildGroup
ctags.pattern: /^function buildGroup({ id, label, children }, expanded, routePath) {$/
